snippet: Vladimir V. Putin, the Russian president, having long taken credit for boom times and cultivated an image of prowess, finds himself unable to end the nation’s longest recession since he came to power.
abstract: Russia's economic downturn is taking toll on Pres Vladimir V Putin's standing as nation's poverty rate increases and industries crumble; Putin's position is all the more delicate because he took personal credit for economic boom that preceded recession.
lead_paragraph: Vladimir V. Putin, the Russian president, having long taken credit for boom times and cultivated an image of prowess, finds himself unable to end the nation’s longest recession since he came to power.

headline.main: Putin Took Credit for the Boom. Now There’s a Bust.
headline.print_headline: Putin Took Credit for Russia’s Economic Boom. Now There’s a Bust.
